alert.note: Alert for St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 2:11PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Charles Parish through 245 PM CDT... At 210 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Sarpy, or over Hahnville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hahnville, Norco, Destrehan, Luling, Taft, New Sarpy, Boutte and Killona. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 215 and 216. Interstate 310 between mile markers 5 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
